short_definition: The introduction of rebuttal evidence. Rebuttal evidence is any evidence that rebuts, counteracts, or disapproves evidence given by a witness or other kind of evidence introduced by the opposing party; rebuttal evidence is offered to contradict other evidence or to rebut a presumption of fact.
